item.title: Understanding and Implementing NSNotificationCenter on Apple's Platforms
item.description: Sometimes when you are writing an app, you need to be notified of events occurring somewhere else in the system - either in your own app, or in the operating system - and react to them accordingly. For example, you may be an app like Snapchat and you want to know when a screenshot has been taken. This is a system notification that you can “listen” to in order to react.
